title: Emailing on behalf of users. Bring Your Own Domain?
description:
Company I’m at does influencer marketing. For example, our users who are mostly Chinese companies can search our platform for YouTube and TikTok creators and then cold email them. Our company now wants to be able to automate emails and send them on behalf of the companies but we don’t want our company email/domain to get marked as spam and have all our users be unable to send emails.

We want each user(company account) to have an email address created for them, which we can send emails out from on their behalf. I know that services like sendgrid can make new user email accounts programmatically but my boss wants for users to have their own domain, that seems like the sticking point.

I haven’t heard of anything that can do this, have you?

Ideas:

  • Get our users to give us access to an email they’ve set up - for example give us SendGrid API key like Auth0 does. Problem with this is that our users are probably not that tech savvy and I’m not even sure SendGrid is popular in China.
  • Register a bunch of domains and assign new customers to each? Doesn’t seem very scalable. Not sure how we could automate this. Also, domains (IP addresses) need to be active for more than 30 days before they start getting decent deliverability.
  • Out of better ideas
description_plain:
Company I'm at does influencer marketing. For example, our users who are mostly Chinese companies can search our platform for YouTube and TikTok creators and then cold email them. Our company now wants to be able to automate emails and send them on behalf of the companies but we **don't want our company email**/domain to get marked as spam and have all our users be unable to send emails.

We want each user(company account) to have an email address created for them, which we can send emails out from on their behalf. I know that services like sendgrid can make new user email accounts programmatically but my boss wants for users to have their own domain, that seems like the sticking point.

I haven't heard of anything that can do this, have you? 

Ideas: 
- Get our users to give us access to an email they've set up - for example give us SendGrid API key like Auth0 [does](https://auth0.com/docs/customize/email/smtp-email-providers/configure-sendgrid-as-external-smtp-email-provider). Problem with this is that our users are probably not that tech savvy and I'm not even sure SendGrid is popular in China.
- Register a bunch of domains and assign new customers to each? Doesn't seem very scalable. Not sure how we could automate this. Also, domains (IP addresses) need to be active for more than 30 days before they start getting decent deliverability. 
- Out of better ideas
